Junior Consultant, Medicine & Cardiology : Ispahani Islamia Eye Institute & Hospital Jobs ENG বাংলা Create Account Sign In For Employer Create Sign In Home Jobs Mybdjobs Job List Ispahani Islamia Eye Institute & Hospital Junior Consultant, Medicine & Cardiology Application Deadline : 19 Feb 2026 Apply Now Shortlist Share: Facebook LinkedIn WhatsApp All Requirements Responsibilities Salary & Benefits Company Information Summary Vacancy: 01 Location: Dhaka Salary: Tk. 131160 - 131160 (Monthly) Published: 20 Jan 2026 To access Application Insights Get Bdjobs Pro Requirements Education Experience Additional Requirements The ideal candidates should have: Must have MD/ Diploma in Cardiology (D-Card) from a recognized institute. Candidates having FCPS (Medicine), MRCP (Medicine), MCPS (Medicine) and DEM will be preferred03 - 05 years of experience in Medicine & Cardiology. Excellent communication skills (Oral & Written) and teamwork (working ability in the multi-disciplinary team). IT savvy and professional skills in MS Office. Responsibilities & Context Junior Consultant, Medicine & Cardiology : We are looking for a Junior Consultant for the Medicine & Cardiology Department to join our team of medical professionals. They will work with patients to provide treatment and ensure fitness for ophthalmic surgeries. They will make diagnoses, provide systemic treatment plans and work with other physicians and surgeons to treat patients’ cardiovascular disorders and other systemic disorders. To be successful as a cardiologist, they will need to make important decisions regarding their patients` care and be emotionally resilient in challenging medical situations. The ability to work and collaborate with Anesthesiologists in the operation theater, when necessary, and with other Surgeons in a complex and diverse environment is also necessary. Major Responsibilities : Consulting with patients to understand their symptoms and health concerns. Identify the cardiac diseases and other systemic diseases regarding patients’ fitness for ophthalmic surgeries through the appropriate tests, diagnoses, etc. Interpreting cardiac test results to determine the suitability for ophthalmic surgeries. Provide appropriate advice in taking cardiac care in line with the appropriateness of ophthalmic treatment and surgeries. Have excellent knowledge and skills in diagnosing and managing diseases in general medicine. Classifying and managing diabetes and endocrine disorders Identifying kidney diseases and urological problems Skills in diagnosing and managing communicable and non-communicable diseases Training and providing educational support to junior staff, when necessary. Performing any other departmental tasks as and when necessary by the management. Coordinate with Anesthesiologist in operation theater when necessary. Skills & Expertise Suggested by Medicine Cardiology Health/ Medical Compensation & Other Benefits Salary As per IIEI&H`s Pay Scale Compensation & other benefits Compet

Responsibilities & Context Nevian Lifescience PLC – formerly Novartis (Bangladesh) Limited – carries forward a 250-year global legacy and a 50-year local heritage in healthcare excellence. With its EU-GMP and ANVISA-certified facility, Nevian produces world-class medicines, including Novartis global brands under license, and serves as the importer and distributor of Novartis’ innovative therapies in Bangladesh. At Nevian, we are a team of passionate professionals driven to make a real difference for patients. We foster a culture where talent is valued, collaboration thrives, and everyone is empowered to perform at their best. Join us and be part of a team making a lasting impact on millions of lives. We are seeking for Medical Information Associate to join our Sales team. Major Responsibilities: Deliver scientific information to Health Care Professionals through face-to-face interactions and digital platforms. We are looking for immediate recruitment for the above post and inviting applications for its “Normal Delivery Unit” A Community Skilled Birth Attendant (CSBA) is a specifically trained, government-certified health worker—typically a Family Welfare Assistant (FWA) or Health Assistant (HA)—who has received six months of training to provide maternal and newborn care, primarily at the community and household level. The CSBA acts as a crucial link in health system to reduce maternal and neonatal mortality by offering services. The core job description includes- Providing routine ANC, including check-ups, monitoring blood pressure, testing urine for albumin, and monitoring fetal health. Conducting safe and clean deliveries at the household level in rural areas. Monitoring the progress of labor and managing normal vaginal deliveries. Using partographs to monitor labor, if trained. Providing essential newborn care, including immediate drying, warming, and breastfeeding initiation. Monitoring the mother and newborn for complications in the immediate postpartum period. Identifying high-risk pregnancies and complications (e.g., eclampsia, prolonged labor, heavy bleeding) and referring them to higher-level facilities. Providing family planning counseling and services. Maintaining records of antenatal, delivery, and postnatal cases, and submitting reports. GSA Oman Air Customer Service Officer / Customer Service Agent Application Deadline : 19 Feb 2026 Apply Now Shortlist Share: Facebook LinkedIn WhatsApp All Requirements Responsibilities Salary & Benefits Company Information Summary Vacancy: -- Age: 25 to 35 years Location: Dhaka, Dhaka (Shahjalal A... Dhaka, Dhaka (Shahjalal Airport) Salary: Negotiable Published: 20 Jan 2026 Applicants are encouraged to submit Video CV. To access Application Insights Get Bdjobs Pro Requirements Education Experience Additional Requirements Age 25 to 35 years 1–3 years of experience in airline customer service, GSA operations, travel agency, or aviation-related roles. Prior experience working with an international airline or GSA will be an added advantage. Strong verbal and written communication skills in English (Bangla proficiency required; Arabic is a plus). Good knowledge of airline reservation and ticketing procedures. Familiarity with GDS systems (Amadeus preferred). Customer-focused mindset with strong problem-solving abilities. Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple tasks efficiently. Professional attitude with strong interpersonal skills. Proficient in MS Office applications. Responsibilities & Context Handle customer inquiries related to flight reservations, ticketing, re-issuance, refunds, and cancellations for Oman Air. Assist passengers with schedule changes, baggage inquiries, special service requests (SSR), and fare rules. Coordinate with Oman Air systems, airline portals, and internal departments to resolve customer issues promptly. Maintain accurate passenger records and ensure proper documentation in airline reservation systems. Liaise professionally with travel agents, corporate clients, and walk-in passengers. Ensure compliance with Oman Air policies, IATA regulations, and company SOPs. Handle customer complaints effectively and escalate complex cases when necessary. Support sales and operations teams as required to achieve service excellence. Maintain confidentiality and professionalism in all interactions with customers. Perform any other duties assigned by management related to customer service operations. Skills & Expertise Suggested by Customer Service Compensation & Other Benefits Provident fund,Weekly 2 holidays Salary Review: Yearly Festival Bonus: 2 Workplace Work at office Employment Status Full Time Job Location Dhaka, Dhaka (Shahjalal Airport) Job Highlights The Customer Service Agent / Customer Service Officer will be responsible for delivering high-quality customer service to passengers and trade partners of Oman Air. Company Information Air Galaxy Ltd. To access Application Insights Get Bdjobs Pro Requirements Responsibilities & Context Visit corporate clients as per schedule. Participate client meeting. Do the Price negotiation. Analysis weekly sales and collection. Make forecasting budget to achieve the monthly sales and collection target. Follow up Industry & NGO Sales & Collection & Make Different Kinds of Report. To collect orders and payment from corporate clients. To maintain clients ledger book individually. To submit work order with DO process sheet in the back office. To prepare daily clients visit report. Next day working plan completed with TASK list. To maintain all information and daily schedule in SPRO. To maintain movement schedule on daily basis. To prepare sales and collection target with achievement. Skills & Expertise Suggested by Corporate Sales Payment Collection price negotiation Sales Forecasting Sales Analysis Compensation & Other Benefits T/A,Mobile bill,Tour allowance,Performance bonus Salary Review: Yearly Festival Bonus: 2 Others benefits as per company. Workplace Work at office Employment Status Full Time Job Location Chattogram, Dhaka Company Information RFL Group Follow More jobs from this company Address: PRAN RFL Center, 105 Middle Badda, Dhaka Business: RFL Group is one of Bangladesh’s largest and most diversified manufacturing conglomerates. Over its 45-year journey, RFL has become synonymous with quality and reliability. The Group offers a wide range of products, including plastics, stationery, metal, melamine, PVC, chemicals, electronics, furniture, industrial products, light engineering, and leather goods. The Warehouse Assistant will play an active role in the smooth operation of HCMP’s busy warehouse by supporting material receiving, dispatching, physical counting, and assisting Warehouse Officers in stock management. They will ensure timely documentation, maintain warehouse cleanliness, organize materials systematically, and actively contribute to continuous improvement, key performance targets, and training initiatives. Check material quality and quantity against requisitions; prepare and approve Delivery Challans/Waybills as required. Regularly inspect and monitor warehouse materials to ensure they are kept in good condition and report any discrepancies. Conduct periodic physical stock counts to ensure alignment between physical stock and book records, documenting findings properly. Manage labor attendance, prepare payment sheets, and ensure efficient labor operations in compliance with warehouse SOPs and Health & Safety regulations. Have good reporting skill with office applications Have willingness to live and work in difficult and rapidly changing conditions. Have ability and willingness to travel and stay in the field. Have excellent language skills both English and Bengali Responsibilities & Context BRAC is an international development organisation founded in Bangladesh in 1972 that partners globally with over 100 million people living with inequality and poverty to create opportunities to realise their potential. This position will oversee the warehouse operations, manage inventory and ensure compliance with organizational policies and safeguarding standards. Additionally, the role requires the delivery of goods to various project sites under the Humanitarian Crisis Management Programme (HCMP) of BRAC within the assigned operational areas. Receive, inspect, and issue store materials with accurate record-keeping; maintain management-wise inventory and delivery sheets separately. Ensure proper store operations, including safe receiving, storage, retrieval, and timely dispatch of goods, maintaining registers as per Purchase Orders (PO). Prepare Goods Receipt Notes (GRN) upon receipt of goods and ensure proper file management of all supporting documents (Waybill, Challan, PO, GRN, etc.). Update ledger books and BIN cards daily after dispatch and receipt of goods; maintain labour registers and supervise labour for efficient operations. Maintain updated store ledgers and assist the Warehouse Supervisor in preparing weekly, monthly and yearly stock statements. Execute all warehouse operational activities, including dispatching materials per IMS software requisitions and arranging transportation for timely delivery. Conduct inventory receipt quality checks with the Quality team to ensure the quality, quantity, and specification compliance of materials received. Issue materials based on approved Supply Requests (SR) and support in the submission of monthly, quarterly, and yearly inventory and project closing reports. Securely maintain goods in the warehouse and ensure regular cleaning, pest control activities, and safety measures to protect inventory from rodents and other damages. Ensure efficient and cost-effective use of dumper transport by planning requisitions at least one day before material delivery. Plan warehouse space allocation in advance

Experience • Essential: Experience in and exposure to working in a complicated political, security and humanitarian environment • Essential: Experience in data collection, reporting and analysis • Essential: Current residency within Chattogram City • Desirable: Two years previous experience in similar jobs in the field of humanitarian aid with MSF or other NGOs • Desirable: Management experience Language • Essential: English, Bangla & Chittagonian desirable Knowledge • Essential computer literacy (word, excel, Internet/social media) • Excellent understanding of MSF’s principles and values • Knowledge of and interest in humanitarian issues • In-depth contextual knowledge and analysis skills • High level of knowledge of local culture and customs Responsibilities & Context • Representing MSF externally together with the Project Coordinator (PC) or alone (when delegated) and negotiating on behalf of the project coordination in close cooperation with the PC and based on beforehand agreed messaging. To access Application Insights Get Bdjobs Pro Requirements Education Experience Additional Requirements Required Qualifications and Skills 3–6 years of experience in business development, sales, or account management, preferably in: Property preservation / real estate services, OR BPO / KPO / outsourcing for US clients, OR Field‑services, facilities management, or construction‑related services. Strong understanding of US business culture and comfort working fully in EST time. Excellent English communication skills (spoken and written), including the ability to lead client calls and write clear, professional emails and proposals. Demonstrated track record of building and managing a B2B sales pipeline and closing deals. High level of comfort with online tools: CRMs, spreadsheets, presentation tools, email automation, LinkedIn, and video‑conferencing platforms. Strong analytical and problem‑solving skills, with the ability to understand operational workflows and convert them into clear client value stories. Self‑driven, disciplined, and comfortable working remotely with minimal supervision. Preferred (Nice to Have) Prior experience selling to US property preservation firms, property managers, or construction/maintenance contractors. Familiarity with vendor portals, work‑order systems, or property‑management software. Experience working in a startup or early‑stage environment, helping to build processes from scratch. Responsibilities & Context Role Overview The Business Development Manager will be responsible for developing and growing a US‑focused property preservation / repairs & renovations coordination business. The role involves building a pipeline of US clients (property preservation companies, property managers, investors), managing relationships, and shaping repeatable sales and account‑management processes. Key Responsibilities Market research and strategy Research the US property preservation, repairs and renovations, and property management market, including key players, services, pricing patterns, and trends. Identify and segment target customers (national property preservation firms, regional contractors, asset managers, REO brokers, property management companies). Develop and periodically update a go‑to‑market plan for US clients, focusing on high‑potential geographies and customer profile

To access Application Insights Get Bdjobs Pro Requirements Education Experience Responsibilities & Context Job Summary Stardust Telecom Limited are looking for an IT Procurement professional responsible for sourcing, purchasing, and managing IT hardware, software, network equipment, security solutions, and related services. The role requires close coordination with vendors, service providers, internal IT teams, and finance to ensure timely procurement, cost control, compliance, and uninterrupted IT operations. Key Responsibilities IT Procurement & Vendor Management Procure IT hardware including laptops, desktops, monitors, printers, servers, networking devices, CCTV, access control systems, and related accessories. Purchase licensed software, subscriptions, and renewals such as Microsoft licenses, security solutions, SSL certificates, and network services. Manage procurement of consumables such as toner cartridges, drums, cables, and spare parts. Identify, evaluate, and negotiate with vendors, suppliers, ISPs, and service providers to ensure competitive pricing and service quality. Service & Contract Management Coordinate annual maintenance contracts (AMC) for printers, PABX, network systems, software, and IT services. Handle service bills for IT-enabled services, internet connectivity, data center services, CDN, IP transit, bandwidth, and peering services. Manage renewals, security deposits, service charges, and monthly or annual IT service invoices. Network, Security & Infrastructure Procurement Procure and manage network infrastructure including switches, routers, firewalls, access points, racks, PoE devices, and cabling. Coordinate procurement for internet links, IPLC, IX, bandwidth upgrades, port charges, and data center services. Support security infrastructure procurement including CCTV systems, access control devices, firewalls, and endpoint security solutions. Asset & Documentation Management Maintain accurate procurement records, purchase orders, invoices, delivery notes, and asset registers. Track IT assets, warranties, service history, and lifecycle status. Ensure compliance with internal procurement policies and audit requirements. Coordination & Support Work closely with IT operations, network teams, and project teams to understand technical requirements. Coordinate repairs, replacements, relocations, and upgrades of IT equipment and network infrastructure. Support IT projects by ensuring timely availability of required hardware, software

Chief Financial Officer : Khansons Group Jobs ENG বাংলা Create Account Sign In For Employer Create Sign In Home Jobs Mybdjobs Job List Khansons Group Chief Financial Officer Application Deadline : 28 Feb 2026 Apply Now Shortlist Share: Facebook LinkedIn WhatsApp All Requirements Responsibilities Skills & Expertise Company Information Summary Vacancy: 01 Age: At least 40 years Location: Dhaka Salary: Negotiable Published: 18 Feb 2026 To access Application Insights Get Bdjobs Pro Requirements Education Experience Additional Requirements Age At least 40 years Preference shall be given to candidates having working experience in Insurance Company. Professional Tenure: A minimum of 10 to 12 years of progressive experience in finance and accounting. Leadership Depth: At least 5 years of post-qualification experience in a senior leadership role (CFO or Head of Finance). Industry Expertise: Direct experience in Life Insurance or Banking is essential. Proven expertise in IDRA regulations, BSEC compliance, and Bangladesh tax/VAT laws is required. Citizenship: Must be a Bangladeshi citizen or permanent resident. Integrity: Must have no history of bankruptcy or being a loan defaulter. Clean Record: No convictions for moral turpitude, fraud, money laundering, or corruption. Independence: Must not be an entrepreneur shareholder, director, or chief executive of the same insurer, nor hold a directorship in any other bank or finance company concurrently. Strategic Leadership: Ability to translate financial data into actionable growth strategies for the Board. Compliance Mastery: Deep working knowledge of the Insurance Act, Company Act, and prevailing tax frameworks in Bangladesh. Technical Proficiency: Advanced skills in ERP systems and specialized insurance management software to drive operational efficiency. Responsibilities & Context This key executive role will oversee all financial operations, ensuring long-term fiscal health and strict regulatory compliance as the company continues its growth across 250+ branches nationwide. The CFO will serve as a strategic partner to the Board of Directors and the CEO, providing high-level financial guidance, managing large-scale operations, and spearheading financial transformation through digital integration. Monitoring day to day Accounts & Finance Department work. Tax related work. Skills & Expertise LIfe Insurance Company Suggested by Financial Reporting Financial Statement Accounts and Finance Workplace Work at office Employment Status Full Time Gender Only males are allowed to apply.
